Why a merger of FELDA and Felcra is unlikely  The Edge Markets MY

CAN the woes at the Federal Land Development Authority (FELDA) be fixed by merging it with another floundering government agency? This question could be ...

item.description:
White Paper unearthed serious problems in Felda's finances, says Azmin  New Straits Times

KUALA LUMPUR: The White Paper on troubled plantation giant Felda has unearthed serious problems in the company's financial position.

item.title: Felda begins disposal of assets to accommodate liabilities - Malaysiakini
item.description:
Malaysiakini

The Federal Land Development Authority (Felda), which is currently embroiled in allegations of mismanagement and mounting debts, has commenced the sales of non-strategic assets to accommodate its liabilities, says chairman Megat Zaharuddin Megat Mohd Nor. “We have started the process of selling non-strategic assets both within and outside the country and this process will probably runs until the middle or end of next year. "It is hoped that the prices we get from the sales of these assets can accommodate our liabilities, as well as help ease the burden of settlers who are saddled with low o...

item.title: FGV sues ex-chair Isa Samad, former CEO over overpriced condo buys - Malaysia Today
item.description:
FGV sues ex-chair Isa Samad, former CEO over overpriced condo buys  Malaysia Today

(MMO) – FGV Holdings Berhad has sued former chairman Tan Sri Isa Samad and former chief executive officer Datuk Mohd Emir Mavani Abdullah over the purchase of two luxury condominium units allegedly for above market price. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia yesterday, the agricultural and agri-commodities company’s board said the lawsuit centred on FGV Holdings Bhd’s purchase of the luxury condominium units at the Troika within the Kuala Lumpur City Centre (KLCC) area “at prices significantly above market value and without proper due diligence”. The lawsuit is also over Isa and Mohd Amir’s “all...

item.title: FGV sues Isa and Mohd Emir - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV sues Isa and Mohd Emir  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd has filed a suit against former chairman Tan Sri Isa Samad (pic, left) and former group president and chief executive officer Datuk Mohd Emir Mavani Abdullah (pic, right) over the acquisition of two luxury condominiums in Persiaran KLCC. FGV announced the legal proceedings against the duo in a filing with Bursa Malaysia dated yesterday, Bernamareported. The company claimed that the units were bought at prices significantly above market value and without due diligence, and that both individuals had unauthorised use and possession of the properties. The suit als...

item.title: FGV freezes hiring of workers from external contractors - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV freezes hiring of workers from external contractors  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: FGV Holdings Bhd has frozen the recruitment of workers from external contractors across its operations with immediate effect. The freeze will only be lifted when it is satisfied that contractors are adhering to all FGV’s internal policies, guidelines and standard operating procedures. In a statement, FGV said it would also revise immediately benefits enjoyed by its plantation workers. It will absorb the cost of basic necessities, including food supplies given to its workers. “The welfare of all our employees is of paramount importance to FGV, and to me personally,” chairman a...

item.title: Market expecting worse to come for FGV - The Star Online
item.description:
Market expecting worse to come for FGV  The Star Online

BASED on FGV Holdings Bhd’s share movements in recent times and with several analysts expecting a worst-case scenario in bottom line for its financial year 2018 (FY18), the market appears to be bracing for the worst. There has been no let up to the relentless selling at the world’s biggest palm oil producer and oil palm plantation operator, as its shares had recently fallen to below the RM1 mark and is now categorised as a penny stock. The somewhat negative market sentiment of late had seen several listed companies taking huge writedowns or impairments that had impacted their bottomlines an...

item.title: FGV posts biggest quarterly loss ever - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV posts biggest quarterly loss ever  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd has posted its biggest quarterly loss ever in the three months to end-September after forensic investigations determined that it had overpaid for a plantation asset purchased in 2014, forcing the company to make a huge impairment charge on the acquisition in the current quarter. The world’s largest palm oil producer made a loss of RM849.25mil in the third quarter ended Sept 30, compared to a net profit of RM41.53mil a year ago. Impairment charges amounted to RM788mil, much of it from Asian Plantations Ltd (APL). Without the impairment, the loss before zakat an...

item.title: FGV expects CPO price to trade at RM1,900-RM2,100 a tonne in 2019 - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV expects CPO price to trade at RM1,900-RM2,100 a tonne in 2019  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd has forecasted the crude palm oil (CPO) price to trade between RM1,900 and RM2,100 per tonne in 2019. “The high CPO stock pile would put pressure on the price,” said chairman and interim CEO Datuk Wira Azhar Abdul Hamid at FGV’s third quarter result briefing on Wednesday. He revealed that FGV’s average production cost ex-mill in the third quarter stood at RM1,777 per tonne. He said FGV is targeting to increase it CPO production by 10% next year.

item.title: FGV targets new CEO appointment by end-January - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV targets new CEO appointment by end-January  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd is targeting to finalise the appointment of its chief executive officer by end-January next year. Its chairman and interim CEO Datuk Wira Azhar Abdul Hamid said there are now down to two candidates for the top post. “I will withdraw from my position as the interim CEO of FGV when we make the selection and will remain as non-executive chairman of the group,” he told reporters at it third quarter result briefing on Wednesday. He, however, declined to name the candidates. Azhar said the appointment of the group’s chief financial officer will also take place in Ja...

item.title: FGV posts Q3 net loss of RM849m net loss, mainly due to APL impairments - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV posts Q3 net loss of RM849m net loss, mainly due to APL impairments  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd posted net losses of RM849.25mil in the third quarter ended Sept 30, 2018,due to impairments totalling RM788mil, muchg of it was from the Asian Plantation Ltd (APL). FGV, the world's largest crude palm oil (CPO) producer, announced on Wenesday the net losses were in contrast with the net profit of RM41.52mil a year ago. Its loss before zakat and tax (LZBT) of RM911mil for Q3 included impairment amounting to RM788mil. “LBZT before impairment came in at RM123mil, which compares to the profit before zakat and tax for the previous corresponding quarter was RM118mi...

item.title: Sale of Felda assets may not be profitable, says Azmin - The Star Online
item.description:
Sale of Felda assets may not be profitable, says Azmin  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Economic Affairs Minister Datuk Seri Mohamed Azmin Ali has voiced concern that the government may not be able to sell Federal Land Development Authority's (Felda) assets at a profitable price. He said the assets were purchased at a price which were higher than the market price. “Even if we decide to monetise these assets, we wouldn't be able to get back the full value of those assets. So, this is our concern now,” he told reporters at the Parliament on Wednesday. Previously, Mohamed Azmin was reported to have said that Felda would dispose off its non-strategic assets as part o...

item.title: FGV sues former president - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV sues former president  The Star Online

It has started proceedings against 13 others for RM514mil damages KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd has commenced legal proceedings against its former group president and CEO Datuk Mohd Emir Mavani Abdullah and 13 others for damages totalling RM514mil as well as other damages in relation to the acquisition of Asian Plantation Ltd (APL). Besides Emir, the others being sued in the Kuala Lumpur High Court include former FGV chairman Tan Sri Mohd Isa Abdul Samad, former business development of downstream cluster vice-president Farisan Mokhtar, former chief financial officer Ahmad Tifli Mohd Talha ...

item.title: MACC preparing to charge Isa Samad over Felda abuse of power, says report - Malaysia Today
item.description:
MACC preparing to charge Isa Samad over Felda abuse of power, says report  Malaysia Today

(The Straits Times, Singapore): The Malaysian authorities are preparing to charge former Umno leader Isa Samad with abuse of power, relating to an overpriced hotel purchase when he was chairman of national land agency Felda. Sources told The Straits Times yesterday that the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) had wrapped up its probe into Felda’s 2014 purchase of the Merdeka Palace hotel in Kuching, Sarawak, and would recommend charges to the Attorney-General’s Chambers (AGC) next week. “There was insufficient evidence (to charge him) due to limited access before, but investigators ...

item.title: Felda United drop key players due to lack of funds - The Star Online
item.description:
Felda United drop key players due to lack of funds  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Felda United have dropped key players due to budget cut ahead of their Malaysia Super League season. Newly-appointed head coach Mohd Nidzam Jalil confirmed that influential Brazilian trio – Thiago Junio, Gilberto Fortunato and Thiago Augusto Fernandes – and the Philippines international Iain Ramsay will be leaving the Jengka-based club. Goalkeeper Farizal Harun and mercurial winger Christie Jeyaseelan were also released by the club last week. In fact, Felda United are set to see 60% of their players from the Premier League-winning squad released. Nidzam said the club would be...

item.title: FGV in tie-up with Dalian Commodity Exchange - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV in tie-up with Dalian Commodity Exchange  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd and China’s Dalian Commodity Exchange (DCE) will work together to expand palm oil futures delivery regionally. FGV said DCE – the world’s largest agriculture, plastics, coal, iron ore futures bourse – aimed to increase cooperation with palm oil companies in the Belt and Road countries. Both parties signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) yesterday that will focus on services offered by FGV subsidiary Felda Johor Bulkers Sdn Bhd (FJB). FJB has extensive experience in the bulking business, with over 860,000 tonnes of total liquid storage capacity across its t...

item.title: FGV probing Asian Plantations deal - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV probing Asian Plantations deal  The Star Online

THE board of FGV Holdings Bhd is said to be looking into the group’s investment in London-listed Asian Plantations Ltd (APL) that was acquired back in 2014. Towards this end, key officials of the company, including former directors and management of FGV, have been queried on APL’s hefty price tag of more than RM1.1bil that was approved. Sources say that the current management of FGV had issued official letters to the previous board members and management team led by former chairman, Tan Sri Isa Samad as well as former group president/CEO Mohd Emir Mavani Abdullah, questioning them on the AP...

item.title: Short Position - The Star Online
item.description:
Short Position  The Star Online

The case for an inheritance tax A LOT of discussion is ongoing about potential new taxes to be introduced in Malaysia. Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad, speaking at an investor conference earlier this month, told Malaysians that they need to brace themselves for new taxes, which would involve some necessary sacrifices and pain. One possible tax, economists say, that could be introduced in Budget 2019 to be tabled next week is the digital tax - making Malaysia the second country in South-East Asia after Singapore to introduce this tax scheme, if that were the case. However, it is spe...

item.title: FGV names its chairman as interim CEO - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV names its chairman as interim CEO  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd has appointed chairman Datuk Wira Azhar Abdul Hamid as interim chief executive officer, the company said in a filing with Bursa Malaysia on Wednesday. The CEO position at FGV has been vacant since Datuk Zakaria Arshad resigned on Sept 18, six days after he was issued a suspension letter and stripped of all duties. Earlier this month, Azhar said the company has a list of 11 names in the running for the top post. FGV said on Wednesday that Azhar’s appointment as an interim CEO will remain until a new CEO is found. “This appointment on an interim basis has been c...

item.title: How FELDA and FGV wasted billions in five years - Malaysia Today
item.description:
How FELDA and FGV wasted billions in five years  Malaysia Today

(Edge) – Economic Affairs Minister Datuk Seri Azmin Ali said recently that he will table a White Paper on the Federal Land Development Authority (FELDA)’s state of affairs in parliament in December. The development agency and its subsidiaries FGV Holdings Bhd and Felda Investment Corp Sdn Bhd (FIC) have spent billions from 2013 to 2017, some on questionable acquisitions. Today, the group is in dire straits financially with FELDA said to be saddled with debts of RM8.05 billion and weak cash flow.

item.title: FGV chairman is interim CEO - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV chairman is interim CEO  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: FGV Holdings Bhd’s chairman, Datuk Wira Azhar Abdul Hamid, has been appointed as its interim chief executive officer (CEO) effective Oct 24 until a new CEO takes charge. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the agri-business group said his current role as chairman would remain unchanged. Azhar, 57, was appointed as chairman with effect from Sept 8 last year. “This appointment as an interim CEO has been concurred by the Minister of Finance (Inc),” FGV said. Earlier this month, Azhar disclosed that 11 candidates were in the running for the post of CEO, noting that two candidates we...

item.title: Govt aims to cut Felda debts to RM6.8bil by year-end - The Star Online
item.description:
Govt aims to cut Felda debts to RM6.8bil by year-end  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The government aims to reduce the Federal Land Development Authority’s (Felda) debts by 15 per cent to RM6.8 billion by the end of this year, said Minister of Economic Affairs, Datuk Seri Mohamed Azmin Ali. The plan to improve Felda’s cash flow situation was part of its newly-installed Board of Director’s main priorities, he said during a question-and-answer session at Dewan Rakyat today. “They have already met with the financial institutions concerned to restructure Felda’s loans,” Mohamed Azmin said, adding, the cash flow situation was also affected by the lower crude palm o...

item.title: MPOA supports Govt initiative towards fulfilling UN SDGs - The Star Online
item.description:
MPOA supports Govt initiative towards fulfilling UN SDGs  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The success of the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) scheme in rural transformation and providing land for the landless has become a model many countries are trying to emulate, according to Malaysian Palm Oil Association (MPOA) chief executive Datuk Mohd Nageeb. In a statement, he said Malaysia has many success stories to tell in rural empowerment and explained why the country’s rural economy has witnessed progressive change since independence. Nageeb said this was made possible through the efforts of the Malaysian government by establishing Agencies with the objecti...

item.title: Two FGV officials among 11 candidates for CEO, says Azhar - The Star Online
item.description:
Two FGV officials among 11 candidates for CEO, says Azhar  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: There are 11 candidates who are in the running for the post of chief executive officer for FGV Holdings Bhd, said its chairman Datuk Wira Azhar Abdul Hamid. He said on Tuesday two of them are from FGV and the rest external candidates. “The CEO position will be decided soon as we need the leader for the company,” Azhar told reporters on the sidelines of the Invest Malaysia conference. When asked if there was a likelihood that a foreign candidate be appointed CEO, he replied: “We are open (to options) but we prefer a local candidate”. The CEO position in FGV was left vacant afte...

item.title: Felda anti-corruption activist Mazlan Aliman proposed to lead agriculture-related agenc - The Star Online
item.description:
Felda anti-corruption activist Mazlan Aliman proposed to lead agriculture-related agenc  The Star Online

TEMERLOH: An activist who fought against abuses and corruption in Felda and for settlers' rights is expected to be appointed as chairman of an agency under the Agriculture and Agro-Based Industry Ministry soon. Minister Datuk Salahuddin Ayub said he had proposed Mazlan Aliman (pic), president of Anak (Persatuan Anak Peneroka Felda Kebangsaan), for the position in gratitude to the activist's role in helping Pakatan Harapan win in Felda areas during the general election. "I have submitted the proposal to the Prime Minister and I am waiting for his approval. "I think Mazlan should be given a p...

item.title: Felda's cash flow ‘almost empty’ - The Star Online
item.description:
Felda's cash flow ‘almost empty’  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: At his first press conference as the chairman of the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda), Tan Sri Megat Zaharuddin Megat Mohd Nor said the plantation group would first need to improve its cash flow and pare down some of its borrowings. The former chairman of the largest banking group in Malaysia, Malayan Banking Bhd (Maybank), described Felda’s current cash flow as “almost empty”. “One thing to tackle is Felda’s cash flow. We could not pay what we should have to the settlers,” said Megat Zaharuddin to reporters at a press conference yesterday. He pointed out that restru...

item.title: Felda targets turnaround in 2 years - The Star Online
item.description:
Felda targets turnaround in 2 years  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) is targeting a turnaround within two years. Its newly appointed chairman, Tan Sri Megat Zaharuddin Megat Mohd Nor, said the firm's main priority now is to strengthen its cash flow and reduce debt. “Right now we are working on monetising our assets in London, Kuching and Kota Kinabalu,” he told reporters at a press conference in Menara Felda on Thursday. “We are also looking to restructure some of our loans,” he added. Megat was appointed the chairman of Felda on July 1. He said the assets include hotels, apartments and student hostels...

item.title: Felda appoints new DG - The Star Online
item.description:
Felda appoints new DG  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) has appointed Datuk Othman Omar as its new director general. Othman, 58, who was a former general manager of Selangor State Development Corp (PKNS), will be reporting to office on Oct 1. He replaces Datuk Abd Ghani Mohd Ali, who has been with the Felda group for 37 years. Othman headed Singapore-listed property developer Oxley Holdings Ltd's Malaysian operations from 2014 to 2016. A civil engineer by training, Othman had previously served as general manager of PKNS for five years until his contract expired on Jan 31, 2018. Under Othma...

item.title: Zakaria resigns from FGV - The Star Online
item.description:
Zakaria resigns from FGV  The Star Online

Suspended CEO also quits as MSM board member PETALING JAYA: FGV Holdings Bhd group president/chief executive officer Datuk Zakaria Arshad (pic) has tendered his resignation after being suspended last Thursday. Separately, Zakaria has also resigned as a board member of MSM Malaysia Holdings Bhd. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, FGV announced that with the resignation of Zakaria, the suspension of his duties at the plantation company would end. “FGV will continue its business as usual. As announced earlier the special board committee two comprising four FGV directors, namely chairman Datuk Wi...

item.title: Zakaria resigns from FGV Holdings - The Star Online
item.description:
Zakaria resigns from FGV Holdings  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd has announced the resignation of Datuk Zakaria Arshad as the group president and chief executive officer. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia on Tuesday the global plantation company said with the resignation, the suspension announced earlier has ended. “The board wishes to inform that with the resignation of Zakaria, the suspension has ended. The forensic investigation referred in FGV’s statement from the board on August 28 shall continue and is expected to be concluded by this year end,’’ it added. FGV said it would continue its business as usual. As announced e...

item.title: Terengganu won’t turn Turtle against Felda in the last eight - The Star Online
item.description:
Terengganu won’t turn Turtle against Felda in the last eight  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Terengganu coach Irfan Bakti has identified the flaws in his side and believes his team are ready to face Felda United in the quarter-finals of the Malaysia Cup. The 10-men Turtles lost 3-2 to Kuala Lumpur in their final Group A match at the Cheras Football Stadium on Saturday but despite the defeat, they still finished top of the group on better goal difference ahead of Perak. Young defender Fazirhikhwan Mat Rani was sent off at the end of the first half and that cost Terengganuthe match but Irfan said he was not affected by the loss. “I think we did well and even after the ...

item.title: Felda out to give their all to earn top spot in their group - The Star Online
item.description:
Felda out to give their all to earn top spot in their group  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Felda United coach B. Sathianathan wants his men to keep their winning momentum going when they take on Melaka in their final Group B match in the Malaysia Cup at the Hang Jebat Stadium tonight. Felda, nicknamed The Fighters, have sealed their berth in the quarter-finals after collecting 10 points after three wins, one draw and one loss but the race to finish group champions is not over. Super League outfit PKNS are breathing down Felda’s neck as they also have 10 points with a similar record and they hold an advantage in the race to finish top as they take on Premier League ...

item.title: Three top executives at FGV leave amid management shake-up - The Star Online
item.description:
Three top executives at FGV leave amid management shake-up  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Three top executives at palm oil producer FGV Holdings Bhd left the company at the end of August, in a management shake-up at the world’s largest crude palm oil producer, three sources familiar with the company operations said on Tuesday. The departure of the senior executives, which has not yet been made public, comes as FGV investigates several of its business practices following ”adverse findings” from an earlier probe into its investments. The investigation, initiated by FGV’s board of directors, is examining poor trading practices and palm oil sales, a worker shortage and...

item.title: Govt hopeful FGV will overcome challenges - The Star Online
item.description:
Govt hopeful FGV will overcome challenges  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The government is hopeful that FGV Holdings Bhd will overcome its current challenges and turn around with the support of the three-member transformation plan team who were appointed in July, says Primary Industries Minister Teresa Kok Suh Sim. She acknowledged the challenges faced by the company, with the ongoing forensic audits and international investigations, while attempting to overcome the uncertainty in the palm oil industry. “But, most importantly is the attitude of the organisation and the team members. Last week, I met the FGV team who briefed me on their transformati...

item.title: FGV plots to return to sustainable profits - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV plots to return to sustainable profits  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The board of FGV Holdings Bhd, led by its chairman Datuk Wira Azhar Abdul Hamid, has introduced new production and cost targets for the plantation company as he plots a return to sustainable profitability. The immediate turnaround plan entails the formation of a special board committee, establishment of transformation office, enhancements in plantation operation as well as review of investigations and proceeding with all legal recourse. FGV had posted a net loss of RM21.9mil in the first six months ended June 30. At a press conference yesterday, Azhar said FGV intended to boos...

item.title: FGV down on Q2 losses - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV down on Q2 losses  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Shares in FGV Holdings Bhd dropped more than 6% after posting losses of RM23.23mil in the second quarter ended June 30, 2018. FGV’s shares were was also under pressure following the management’s statement of “adverse findings” by forensic investigator, which is currently looking into six transactions and investments of the company’s past management. Shares in FGV closed 10 sen lower yesterday to RM1.55. FGV said its plantation sector recorded a loss of RM6.53mil in the second quarter of 2018, which was a steep decline from a profit of RM159.88mil in the previous corresponding...

item.title: FGV shares drop nearly 7% in early trade - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV shares drop nearly 7% in early trade  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Shares of FGV Holdings Bhd fell 7% in early trade after reports said it was investigating several of its business practices following “adverse findings” from an earlier probe into its investments. The plantation counter slipped 11 sen, or 6.66% to RM1.54 with over six million shares done. FGV said the internal investigations are examining open credit lines, poor purchasing trading practices and palm oil sales, direct awards of procurement contracts that breach best practices, and the shortage of workers from mid-2016 to mid-2018 that resulted in financial losses over the perio...

item.title: FGV sinks into the red in Q2, net loss RM23m - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV sinks into the red in Q2, net loss RM23m  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd sank into the red with net losses of RM23.23mil in the second quarter ended June 30, 2018 as crude palm oil (CPO) prices fell and fresh fruit bunchs (FFB) output declined. This was a sharp contrast with the net profit of RM37.25mil a year ago for the world's largest CPO producer due to losses in the plantation sector. FGV announced on Tuesday profit before zakat and tax (PBZT) fell by 98.7% to RM1.25mil from the RM102.44mil a year ago. Revenue fell by 18.4% to RM3.43bil from RM4.21bil. Loss per share was 0.64 sen compared with earnings per share of 1.02 sen. “...

item.title: FGV’s management under probe - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV’s management under probe  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The management of FGV Holdings Bhd is under probe as the plantation company, which covers 52 parliamentary seats in the Malay heartland, slipped into the red in the second quarter. FGV registered a net loss of RM23.23mil in the second quarter ended June 30, 2018, due to lower productivity, rising production cost, higher share of losses from joint ventures and associate companies as well as lack of operational effectiveness and efficiencies. The board did not mince its words as it acknowledged that the management needed to take steps to enhance operational efficiencies and fel...

item.title: FGV transformation office to unveil operational turnaround plan - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV transformation office to unveil operational turnaround plan  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd's high-powered task force to turn around the loss-making plantation giant, announced on Tuesday there were serious issues at multiple levels of the organisation. According to the findings of the Transformation Office (TO), set up in April 2018, the issues ranged from poor work discipline, operational inefficiencies to leakages that need to be addressed immediately. “The TO will submit its final report to the board in the next few weeks,” it said, adding the TO was finalising audits into estate and mill operations and downstream processes. The world's largest c...

item.title: A reality check for Felda - The Star Online
item.description:
A reality check for Felda  The Star Online

BACK in 2012, the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) gained a whopping RM5bil in gross proceeds from the listing of its then unit, Felda Global Ventures Holdings Bhd (which has since been renamed FGV Holdings Bhd) on Bursa Malaysia. Fast-tracked six years later, Felda is now saddled with a huge debt of RM8.025bil. Hence, this bring into question as to why Felda is facing such a critical financial problem, despite its various strategic acquisitions and investments touted to generate profitable income for the politically-linked government agency? Furthermore, some of these acquisition...

item.title: Felda has to seek govt assistance as it is facing cashflow problem - The Star Online
item.description:
Felda has to seek govt assistance as it is facing cashflow problem  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Apart from a forensic audit, the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) is undertaking a review of its role as the guardian of the settlers, following cashflow problems faced by the agency. It is learnt that Felda has to go to the government to get financial resources to undertake programmes such as providing the settlers with short-term loans and infrastructure in its schemes. “Felda’s main source of income was from FGV Holdings Bhd. But that has come down significantly. To compound the problem is Felda having debts of RM8bil,” said a source. Towards this end, the review...

item.title: New forensic audit on dubious Felda deals? - The Star Online
item.description:
New forensic audit on dubious Felda deals?  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) is expected to undertake another round of forensic audit investigations on several dubious investment deals under its previous management, say sources. A source told StarBiz that newly appointed Felda chairman, Tan Sri Megat Zaharuddin Megat Mohd Nor, has been tasked to spearhead the forensic audit team to investigate all the activities, decisions and actions targeted at the suspicious acquisitions, including PT Eagle High Plantations TBK (EHP). EHP is a loss-making, public-listed Indonesian planter controlled by billionaire Pete...

item.title: Azmin Ali: White Paper on Felda to be tabled in Parliament - The Star Online
item.description:
Azmin Ali: White Paper on Felda to be tabled in Parliament  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: A White Paper on the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) will be tabled in Parliament, says Economic Affairs Minister Datuk Seri Azmin Ali. “The Government has agreed that a White Paper be tabled in the next meeting to expose the true situation of Felda and strategic rehabilitation plans,” he said when answering a question by Ma'mun Sulaiman (Warisan-Kalabakan) during Minister’s Question Time in Parliament on Thursday (Aug 9). Azmin said the White Paper would also contain the views of Felda’s new board of directors and management on the appropriateness of the company’s ...

item.title: Mohd Bakke to bring vast experience to palm oil industry - The Star Online
item.description:
Mohd Bakke to bring vast experience to palm oil industry  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The appointment of Tan Sri Mohd Bakke Salleh, 64, as the new chairman of the Malaysian Palm Oil Board (MPOB) is expected to benefit the palm oil industry tremendously, given his vast experience, Phillip Futures Sdn Bhd dealer, David Ng said. Mohd Bakke would bring with him profound knowledge of the industry which would be of great advantage to the industry especially at a time when it is facing many challenges like rising inventories, declining prices and subdued exports. A statement from MPOB yesterday announced Bakke’s appointment as chairman for a two-year term, effective J...

item.title: Former Felda chairman seeking to strike out suit by housing company - The Star Online
item.description:
Former Felda chairman seeking to strike out suit by housing company  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR:Former Felda chairman Tan Sri Shahrir Abdul Samad is seeking to strike out a suit by housing development company Synergy Promenade Sdn Bhd against him over the Felda land issue. Shahrir's counsel Farah Shuhadah Razali said her client filed the striking-out application last week on the grounds that there was no basis for Synergy Promenade to ask for RM100mil. Farah said the firm has also applied to strike out Shahrir'sdefence. "The High Court later fixed Oct 1 for case management," she said after meeting High Court deputy registrar Catherine Nicholas in chambers on Thursday (Aug...

item.title: Megat Zaharuddin is new Felda chairman - The Star Online
item.description:
Megat Zaharuddin is new Felda chairman  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Tan Sri Megat Zaharuddin Megat Mohd Nor (pic), the former chairman of Malayan Banking Bhd (Maybank), has been appointed chairman of the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) with immediate effect. In a statement Friday, Felda said Megat Zaharuddin has extensive experience in the corporate sector. “He has served as chairman of Maybank for more than seven years. “In addition to the extensive experience in the oil and gas sector for 31 years, he was also chairman of Maxis Communications Bhd from 2004 to 2007; Etiqa Insurance & Takaful from 2006 to 2009; was with the Malaysi...

item.title: Sept 14 date for Wan Azizah appeal against Felda defamation damages - The Star Online
item.description:
Sept 14 date for Wan Azizah appeal against Felda defamation damages  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA (Bernama): The Court of Appeal has fixed Sept 14 for case management in the appeal by Deputy Prime Minister Datin Seri Dr Wan Azizah Wan Ismail (pic) and two others relating to a High Court order that they pay RM2mil in damages to the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) and its subsidiary for defamation. Deputy registrar Aina Azahra Arifin set the date for Felda to inform its stand on whether it would concede or challenge the appeal. Lawyer Nor Emelia Mohd Iszeham representing Felda and its subsidiary Felda Global Ventures Holdings Bhd (FGV) told reporters that she had also...

item.title: FGV refutes allegations by NGO for Felda settlers - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV refutes allegations by NGO for Felda settlers  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd has refuted allegations by ANAK, a non-governmental organisation (NGO) representing Felda settlers, concerning the corporate exercise leading to its listing in 2012. It said on Wednesday the allegations in a video, which was posted on YouTube social media channel, had caused much confusion and concern. Among the inaccuracies highlighted in the video was that FGV Holdings bough a 51% stake in Felda Holdings Bhd (FHB) from Koperasi Permodalan Felda (KPF) for RM2.2bil. It pointed out the video also alleged the price tag of RM2.2bil was far below the market value ...

item.title: Felda beat Sarawak to gain promotion - The Star Online
item.description:
Felda beat Sarawak to gain promotion  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Felda United scored a 3-1 win over Sarawak to become the Premier League champions and automatically qualify for the Super League next year. In the match at the Sarawak State Stadium yesterday, Felda took the lead in the sixth minute through Gilberto Fortunato’s goal, before Thiago Fernandes doubled their lead five minutes from half-time. Mateo Roskam pulled one back for Sarawak in the 45th minute but Fortunato sealed the win from the spot in the 67th minute. The win has taken Felda 10 points in front of second-placed Felcra FC, who only have three remaining matches to play. F...

item.title: FGV is proud of its roots, will continue to support smallholders - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV is proud of its roots, will continue to support smallholders  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd is proud of its roots which runs deep in Malaysia’s first smallholders programme established under the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) and will continue to support and champion the cause of all smallholders. FGV itself has its genesis in Felda and until today continues to work closely with smallholders and settler families, offering the critical link between farmer and marketplace. In fact, FGV is acknowledged as one of the largest supporters of smallholders in the world, said Group President and Chief Executive Officer Datuk Zakaria Arshad today. “...

item.title: Felda needs external forensic audit, says Azmin - The Star Online
item.description:
Felda needs external forensic audit, says Azmin  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Economic Affairs Minister Mohamed Azmin Ali told the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda), which is currently embroiled in a land deal scandal, that “it needs an external forensic audit to get the bottom of this”. However, it is not sure if the minister was referring to the land deal during his meeting with the authority here yesterday. “I was briefed on this (yesterday) morning by Felda director-general Datuk Ab Ghani Mohd Ali on Felda’s management and financial status,” he tweeted with a picture of the meeting. This was followed by another tweet: “Azmin to Felda: Meet ...

item.title: More than 100 top officials are expected to go in major shake-up - Malaysia Today
item.description:
More than 100 top officials are expected to go in major shake-up  Malaysia Today

A major shake-up among the head honchos of government-linked companies (GLCs) is expected to take place in the coming weeks. (The Star) – Politically-appointed heads of GLCs are in focus given that their appointments were made at the pleasure of the previous Government. Many of the heads of GLCs were given board positions as recognition of their services. A source pointed out that there were more than 100 names on a so-called “watch list”, including GLCs’ top brass, board members and senior management officials. GLCs that bear watching would be those that have politically-appointed people o...

item.title: FGV a takeover target ? - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV a takeover target ?  The Star Online

Speculation that world’s largest CPO company is being eyed resurfaces THE world’s largest crude palm oil (CPO) producer, Felda Global Ventures Holdings Bhd (FGV), may be a takeover target. According to sources, the parties interested in the world’s largest crude palm oil producer could include local plantation companies looking to expand their landbank. This is not the first time there has been speculation that FGV could be a takeover target. Just recently – about two months ago – there was talk about FGV undergoing a possible restructuring or a takeover after a report by International Palm...

item.title: Felda Global Ventures proposes name change to FGV Holdings - The Star Online
item.description:
Felda Global Ventures proposes name change to FGV Holdings  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Felda Global Ventures Holdings Bhd (FGV) has proposed to change its name to FGV Holdings Bhd. FGV’s board is of the opinion that the proposed change of name, would reflect its business direction under our flagship brand FGV, it said in a circular to shareholders on Tuesday. “This change would allow FGV to develop its own distinct brand and identity, separate from Felda, our major shareholder and enable stakeholders to better differentiate between the two entities. “The proposed change of name will also serve to further enhance the marketability of our products, strengthen the ...

item.title: FGV lauds new government's non-interference stance in GLCs - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV lauds new government's non-interference stance in GLCs  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Felda Global Ventures Holdings Bhd (FGV) supports the government's non-interference stance with regards to government-linked companies (GLCs), said Chief Executive Officer (CEO), Datuk Zakaria Arshad. “We have been assured by the Council of Eminent Persons (CEP) that there will not be any more interference from politicians, moving forward,” he told reporters after giving a briefing to the CEP on the company's overall operations and administration here, today. The council was also briefed by the National Felda Settlers' Children Association Chairman, Mazlan Aliman, Felda's form...

item.title: FGV boss: TEP gave suggestions on ways to improve ops - The Star Online
item.description:
FGV boss: TEP gave suggestions on ways to improve ops  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Several recommendations to enhance the operations of Felda Global Ventures were made by the Team of Eminent Persons (TEP), said its group president and chief executive officer Datuk Zakaria Arshad (pic). Zakaria said the recommendations were also given by other experts in the palm oil plantation industry in a meeting on Friday (May 18) morning. He declined to reveal specifically what the recommendations were, when asked by reporters after the meeting at Ilham Tower here. "I can't share what these recommendations are as I would need to bring up these recommendations to the boar...

item.title: Shahrir steps down from Felda - The Star Online
item.description:
Shahrir steps down from Felda  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) chairman Tan Sri Shahrir Samad is said to have stepped down from his post on Monday. A farewell gathering was held for Shahrir at the Menara Felda headquarters in Kuala Lumpur. Staff were seen sending him off following the event. Shahrir was appointed as chairman in January 2017, taking over from Tan Sri Isa Samad.
